00025 #if !defined(KERNELVALUE_HPP)
00026 #define KERNELVALUE_HPP
00027 
00028 #include <iostream>
00029 #include <string>
00030 #include <stdexcept>
00031 #include <vector>
00032 #include <cmath>

00034 
00035 #include <loos_defs.hpp>

00038 namespace loos {
00039 
00040   namespace internal {
00041 
00042     const float FLT_THRESHOLD = 1e-10;     // Threshold for floating equality
00043 
00045 
00050     struct Value {
00052       enum ValueType { NONE, STRING, INT, FLOAT };  // What type of data
00053       // the union contains...
00054     
00055       ValueType type;
00056       union {
00057         std::string *str;
00058         float flt;
00059         int itg;
00060       };
00061 
00063       void copy(const Value& v) {
00064         switch(v.type) {
00065         case STRING:
00066           str = new std::string(*(v.str)); break;
00067         case INT:
00068           itg = v.itg; break;
00069         case FLOAT:
00070           flt = v.flt; break;
00071         case NONE:
00072         default:
00073           ;
00074         }
00075         type = v.type;
00076       }
00077 
00078 
00079       Value() : type(NONE) { }
00080       ~Value() { if (type == STRING) delete str; }
00081 
00082       Value(const Value& v) { copy(v); }
00083 
00084       const Value& operator=(const Value& v) { copy(v); return(*this); }
00085 
00086       Value(const std::string s) { setString(s); }
00087       Value(const float f) { setFloat(f); }
00088       Value(const int i) { setInt(i); }
00089 
00090       void setString(const std::string s) { str = new std::string(s); type = STRING; }
00091       void setFloat(const float f) { flt = f; type = FLOAT; }
00092       void setInt(const int i) { itg = i; type = INT; }
00093 
00095       std::string getString(void) const {
00096         if (type != STRING)
00097           throw(std::runtime_error("Expected a string value..."));
00098         return(*str);
00099       }
00100 
00102       float getFloat(void) const {
00103         if (type != FLOAT)
00104           throw(std::runtime_error("Expected a float value..."));
00105         return(flt);
00106       }
00107 
00109       int getInt(void) const {
00110         if (type != INT)
00111           throw(std::runtime_error("Expected an int value..."));
00112         return(itg);
00113       }
00114 
00116       friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const Value& v) {
00117         switch(v.type) {
00118         case STRING:
00119           os << "<VALUE TYPE='STRING'>" << *(v.str) << "</VALUE>";
00120           break;
00121         case FLOAT:
00122           os << "<VALUE TYPE='FLOAT'>" << v.flt << "</VALUE>";
00123           break;
00124         case INT:
00125           os << "<VALUE TYPE='INT'>" << v.itg << "</VALUE>";
00126           break;
00127         case NONE:
00128         default:
00129           os << "<VALUE TYPE='NONE'/>";
00130         }
00131         return(os);
00132       }
00133 
00134     };
00135 
00136     // There really oughtta be a better way to handle this...
00137 
00138 
00140 
00151     int compare(const Value&, const Value&);
00152 
00153 
00154   }
00155 }
